landing.headline: Manufacturing Capacity Calculator
landing.description: Calculate and compare your theoretical production capacity versus actual output. Supports batch-process industries and discrete/continuous manufacturing.

features.batchDesc: Chemical, ceramic, paint, food & beverage, pharma
features.bottleneckDesc: Identify the weakest link in your production chain

processType.title: Select Your Process Type
processType.subtitle: Choose the manufacturing process that best describes your operation.
processType.batchDesc: Production in discrete batches — chemical reactions, mixing, fermentation, coating, baking. Each batch has a fixed size and processing time.
processType.discreteDesc: Unit-by-unit production — assembly lines, CNC machining, injection molding, packaging. Each unit has a cycle time.

form.title: Production Parameters
form.subtitle: Enter your production line details to calculate capacity.

common.linesTooltip: Number of parallel production lines or machines
common.shiftsTooltip: Number of work shifts in a 24-hour period
common.availabilityTooltip: Proportion of scheduled time the equipment is available (0–1). Accounts for breakdowns and unplanned stops.
common.efficiencyTooltip: Ratio of actual speed to ideal speed (0–1). Accounts for slow cycles and minor stoppages.
common.yieldTooltip: Proportion of output that meets quality standards (0–1). Accounts for scrap and rework.

batch.batchSizeTooltip: Number of units or volume produced per batch
batch.batchTimeTooltip: Total time to complete one batch including setup, processing, and teardown
batch.downtimeTooltip: Additional downtime between batches for cleaning, changeover, etc.

discrete.cycleTimeTooltip: Time to produce one unit including all operations
discrete.outputRateTooltip: Units produced per hour. Leave blank if cycle time is provided — it will be calculated automatically.

results.title: Capacity Analysis Results
results.subtitle: Your production capacity breakdown
results.theoreticalDesc: Maximum possible output under ideal conditions
results.effectiveDesc: Realistic capacity considering availability and efficiency
results.utilizationDesc: Ratio of actual output to theoretical maximum
results.bottleneckDesc: The process step limiting your overall throughput
